name: Main fuse type and size & Correct fuse type and size
Trip value & Reset value in OHMS
Continuity measured between all external connection points associated with the slab under construction, i.e. from one external point to all other external connection points.
External Connection to External Connection - Less than figure nominated in specification i.e., 100 mΩ
Where rebar couplers are used for ECR purposes they shall be tested as follows:
a. From the ECR test reference location, measure the resistance to the connecting rebar element approximately 50mm from the coupler.
b. Take an additional measurement to the coupler.
c. Compare the two results: and ensure difference is - no greater than figure nominated in specification i.e., 100 mΩ
Confirm following items comply with requirements
Check that cable to be installed matches Job Spec Requirement ie. Brand and Class
Check that all cable pathways comply with ACA and Vendor requirements.
Install cables, making sure of all strain and bend radius requirements, label cables correctly.
Bundle sizes to be checked to Specification and number of cables not exceeded.
Cables to be tied in with Cable Ties as per specified distance between ties.
All Clearances between power and other services to be maintained as per requirements.
Corro to be extended to outlet position if segregation is required from power in same cavity.
Install Components (splitters, Taps Amps etc) onto Backboards as per design.
Install all cable links and Terminators as required to backboard components
Install Back boards in riser or designated position.
Loom cables neatlt to back board, make sure that the cables are loomed to the correct component.
Terminate cables in Riser or nominated backboard location.
Check position of outlets on Architectural plans if available.
Terminate cables in the field as per regulations and Vendor requirements
Set up Head End as per Design and terminate cables.
Check Signal with aerial and meter on roof to determine the best location for mounting.
Install aerials in the designated location and connect cables.
Test all outlets to the relevant standards and Vendor requirements.
Supply test results and Asbuilt plans to Office.

Type and configuration is as specified
Cores are of correct Cross Sectional Area
Is installed in a neat and orderly manner

Cable has correct origin and destination & follows the correct route

Is secured properly & correctly supported as specified
Is installed in a neat & orderly manner with inter cable spacing/segregation
Gland is correct type & size, & also fitted & secured properly.
Cores loomed neatly with correct identification
Cores in the correct terminals & correctly tensioned

Confirm following items comply with requirements
Compare equipment nameplate data with drawings and specifications.
Inspect physical, electrical, and mechanical condition. (Look for signs of moisture penetration)
Inspect bus for physical damage and proper connection in accordance with single-line diagram
Inspect for proper bracing, suspension alignment, and enclosure ground. (Verify that the bus duct is properly braced between floors and horizontal runs.)
Verify tightness of accessible bolted electrical connections by calibrated torque wrench method in accordance with manufacturer’s published data.
Mark the head of the bolt with a permanent marking pen. (Lose connections will cause heating and damage to connection.)
Check for proper physical orientation per manufacturer’s labels to ensure proper cooling. (prevents bus duct from heat damage when at full load)
Perform continuity tests on each conductor to verify a proper phase relationship exists. (This is especially important when transition sections are used.)
Check outdoor busway for removal of “weep-hole” plugs, if applicable, and the proper installation of joint shield. (Failure to remove plugs will cause moisture build up and bus duct failure.)
Check for proper fire blocking material and installation between floors.
Check for correct type (T), position (P), clearances (C), & attachment (A) of
Check Door Activation (D), Relay Activation (R), Call Button Functions (C), Auxillary button functions (A)
Check Picture Quality (P), Audio Quality (A), Names and numbers (N)
Confirm following items comply with requirements
Check all control devices power supplies are correct type and size
Check volatage of system at furtherest point.
Check that all cables are the correct type, size, configuration, length & quantity
Visually check all terminations for correct colour codes and acceptable looming
Meter Installation - Check that the meter is
Installed in correct location on switchboard in accordance with drawing
Has been terminated and termination is correct
Confirm that factory calibration certificate has been supplied (attach to ITP)
Confirm CT type, size and direction are correct
Connect load,apply clamp tester and confirm meter reading against clamp tester
Confirm meter reading in location simultaneously with metering head end reading
Confirm meter reading in location simultaneously with BMS head end reading
Confirm meter reading from BMS independently. Result equals previous test

Clean & vacuum the outside of the switchboard

Check components and wiring for any signs of deterioration or overheating

Check door isolator interlocking is working correctly
Check pole fillers are in place
Check screws and bolts for tightness. (Pull test on cables after tightening check)
Check calibration of circuit breaker settings
Check operation of RCD's. (Record results on QA_FRM_009_RCD Test Register)
Check power switching components are within design life
